McNemar Test

Test if the proportions of two dichotomous variables are equal in the same population.

mcnemar_test(x, y = NULL)

Arguments

x
2 x 2 matrix or 2 x 2 table or numeric variable or factor variable
y
numeric or factor variable

Value

mcnemar_test returns an object of class "mcnemar_test". An object of class "mcnemar_test" is a list containing the following components:

References

Sheskin, D. J. 2007. Handbook of Parametric and Nonparametric Statistical Procedures, 4th edition. : Chapman & Hall/CRC.

See also

cochran.qtest

Examples

mcnemar_test(matrix(c(172, 7, 6, 15), nrow = 2))
#>        McNemar's Test        
#> ----------------------------
#> McNemar's chi2        0.0769 
#> DF                         1 
#> Pr > chi2             0.7815 
#> Exact Pr >= chi2           1 
#> ----------------------------
#> 
#>        Kappa Coefficient         
#> --------------------------------
#> Kappa                     0.6613 
#> ASE                       0.0873 
#> 95% Lower Conf Limit      0.4901 
#> 95% Upper Conf Limit      0.8324 
#> --------------------------------
#> 
#> Proportion With Factor 
#> ----------------------
#> cases             0.89 
#> controls         0.895 
#> ratio           0.9944 
#> odds ratio      0.8571 
#> ----------------------
mcnemar_test(matrix(c(15, 7, 6, 172), nrow = 2))
#>        McNemar's Test        
#> ----------------------------
#> McNemar's chi2        0.0769 
#> DF                         1 
#> Pr > chi2             0.7815 
#> Exact Pr >= chi2           1 
#> ----------------------------
#> 
#>        Kappa Coefficient         
#> --------------------------------
#> Kappa                     0.6613 
#> ASE                       0.0873 
#> 95% Lower Conf Limit      0.4901 
#> 95% Upper Conf Limit      0.8324 
#> --------------------------------
#> 
#> Proportion With Factor 
#> ----------------------
#> cases            0.105 
#> controls          0.11 
#> ratio           0.9545 
#> odds ratio      0.8571 
#> ----------------------
mcnemar_test(table(hsb$female, hsb$schtyp))
#>     McNemar's Test      
#> -----------------------
#> McNemar's chi2        56.4667 
#> DF                    1 
#> Pr > chi2             0 
#> Exact Pr >= chi2      0 
#> -----------------------
#> 
#>         Kappa Coefficient         
#> ---------------------------------
#> Kappa                      0.0106 
#> ASE                        0.0485 
#> 95% Lower Conf Limit      -0.0846 
#> 95% Upper Conf Limit       0.1057 
#> ---------------------------------
#> 
#> Proportion With Factor 
#> ----------------------
#> cases            0.455 
#> controls          0.84 
#> ratio           0.5417 
#> odds ratio      0.1538 
#> ----------------------
